EmailTemplate.subject: CX Minute Episode 4: Stay on Point
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Learn to build a vertical message.
<[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/]]> <[[https://twitter.com/Honeywell_Aero]]> <[[http://www.youtube.com/honeywell]]> <[[https://plus.google.com/109803702550636260475]]> <[[http://www.linkedin.com/company/honeywell-aerospace]]>
In 60-seconds <[[https://corpapp.honeywell.com/sites/honvideo/Pages/Player.aspx?bctid=4885740397001&UsrId=e045068&ItmId=5995]]> we’ll show you how to write a message that stays on point. And your customer engaged.
Since everyone in the company is responsible for communicating well, everyone is also responsible for writing well. Most of us rely on email to send a message to a customer. And while our message tries to explain everything, we end up saying nothing. Part of writing well is deciding where one piece ends and another begins. Remember:
If you don’t hold the line, you’ll be dragged around by it.
Want to get started? Watch the next CX Minute writing video <[[https://corpapp.honeywell.com/sites/honvideo/Pages/Player.aspx?bctid=4885740397001&UsrId=e045068&ItmId=5995]]> now! Then, let us know what you think. And how we can help you.
